utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Janice has a question. Who of the six of you has sleep with the six of you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, it’s like a dirty math problem.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry the answer there would be...none of us.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Come on over the years none of you ever y'know, got drunk and stupid.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, that’s really a different question.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I’m sorry I find it hard to believe that a group of people who spends as much time together as you guys do has never bumped uglies.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, there was that one time that Monica and Rachel got together.

utterance.speaker: Monica and Rachel
utterance.content: What?!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Excuse me, there was no time!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, but let’s say there was. How might that go?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Okay, okay, well then answer me this. Has any of you ever.... almost?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Does anybody need more coffee?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll take some.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, there’s a dog out there!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, that is so unfortunate.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Cute naked guy is really starting to put on weight.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll be back in just a minute. Oh, Phoebe I’m sorry that I left lipstick marks on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You didn’t leave lipstick marks on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, then it must’ve been you. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Bye-bye! That’s why I moved out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, y'know while we’re on that, when are you gonna tell my sister that you don’t live here anymore.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I think on some levels she already knows.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, she doesn’t know that you sneak out every night, she doesn’t know that you sneak back every morning, and she doesn’t know that you’ve been living with your Grandmother’s for a week now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, well maybe not on those levels.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m never gonna find a roommate, ever.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why, nobody good?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well let’s see, there was the guy with the ferrets, that’s plural. The spitter. Oh-ho, and yes, the guy that enjoyed my name so much he felt the need to make a little noise every time he said it. Nice to meet you, Chandler Bing Bing! Great apartment Chandler Bing, Bing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So how many more do you have tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Two. This photographer, who seemed really dull. And this actor guy, who I’m not sure about, because when he called and I answered the phone ‘Chandler Bing,’ he said ‘Whoa-whoa, short message.’

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross , foot on the floor or come over no more!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure, your dresser is missing but this she notices.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I have to go. Yeah, Carol should be home by now, soo...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Umm, how’s it going with you guys?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, better, actually. Y'know I-I-I think I finally figured out why we were having so much trouble lately.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, y'know how I have you guys, well she doesn’t really have any close friends that are just hers, but last week she meet this woman at the gym, Susan something, and they really hit it off, and I-I-I think it’s gonna make a difference

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Soo, ah, Eric, what kind of photography do ya do?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh, mostly fashion, so there may be models here from time to time, I hope that’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, that is cool. Because I have models here y'know......never.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, during the summer, I spend most weekends at my sister’s beach house, which you are welcome to use by the way. Although, I should probably tell you, she’s a porn star.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, listen I ah, still have one more person to ah meet, but unless it turns out to be your sister, I think you’re chances are pretty good. All right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bedroom. Bathroom. Living room. This right here is the kitchen, and thanks for coming by, Bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Don’t you ah, don’t you wanna ask me any questions?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure. Ummm. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, ah, I’m an actor. I’m fairly neat. I ah, I got my own TV. Oh, and don’t worry I’m totally okay with the gay thing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What gay thing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, y'know just in general people being gay, thing. I’m totally cool with that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well okay Jerry, thanks for stopping by.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, Mon.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey. You wanna hear something that sucks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do I ever.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chris says they’re closing down the bar.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No way!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, apparently they’re turning it into some kinda coffee place.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Just coffee! Where are we gonna hang out now?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Got me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Can I get a beer.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, did you pick a roommate?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You betcha!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is it the Italian guy?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Um-mm, yeah right!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He’s so cute.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yes, and that’s what I want a roommate that I can walk around with and be referred to as the funny one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh look, the pool table’s free. Rack ‘em up. I’ll be back in just a minute. Get ready for me to whip your butt.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, but after that, we’re shootin’ some pool.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, um, no, no, no, no excuse me, hello. Hi. My friend ordered an onion, not an olive, and uh I ordered a rum and Diet Coke, which I don’t think this is.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s all right. I mean hard is it to get a couple drinks right, huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ummm, I think it’s time to see the ring again.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Well maybe it’s just the idea of Barry for the rest of my life. I don’t know I think I feel like I need to have one last fling, y'know, just to sorta get it out of my system.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m serious, I really, I think I need just to have some...meaningless, sex y'know, with the next guy that I see.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excuse, I seem to have dropped my ball.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And now I’ve picked it up again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, I went to high school with her. Rachel! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica! Look! Hi! What do ya think?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, you can’t even see where the Titanic hit it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, his name is Barry, he’s a doctor, thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Awww, just like you always wanted. Congratulations

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you. So how-how ‘bout you, are-are you seeing anybody?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Aww, not right now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, but that’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, I’ll get-get back to my friend.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure, sure, sure, sure. Listen, can we please have lunch the next time I’m in the city?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, that’d be great.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Bye! Ten bucks says, I never see that woman again in my life.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No real-, honey, really it’s fine, just g-go with Susan. Really, I, no, I think girls night out is a great idea. Okay, okay, bye

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So what are they doing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know, something girlie.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, you’re early.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing with the lamp?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m just taking it to be re-wired.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, well don’t take it to the same place you took the stereo, ‘cause they’ve had that thing for over a week.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, Mr. Heckles no one is making any noise up here.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Heckles
utterance.content: You’re disturbing my oboe practice.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You don’t play the oboe!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Heckles
utterance.content: I could play the oboe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Then I’m gonna have to ask you to keep it down.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Heckles
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Eric, I’m gonna be Chandler’s new roommate.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Heckles
utterance.content: I’m Chandler’s new roommate.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I-I-I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Heckles
utterance.content: I could be Chandler’s new roommate.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: But, he told me over the phone.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Heckles
utterance.content: He told me in person.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: That’s weird.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Heckles
utterance.content: Well, I’m going to go into my new apartment now. Ehh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi, again.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you soo, much.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, don’t thank me, thank the jerk that never showed up. Okay, I gotta get to get to work.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You want some help with that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, no thanks, I got it. No I don’t!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Whoa! Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whew! Stood up to fast, got a little head rush.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s the heat. And-and the humidity.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s a uh, that’s a tough combination.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you wanna come in for some lemonade?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Like you wouldn’t believe. Wow! This is a great place.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you. Just make yourself comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This place is really my Grandmother’s. I got it from her when she moved to Florida, otherwise I could never afford a place like this. So if the landlord ever asks, I’m 87 year old woman, who’s afraid of her VCR. So are you thirsty?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, you bet I am!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, here’s your penis!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!!! What are you doing?!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You said, you wanna come in for some lemonade?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa, ah!! We’re you just gonna give me some lemonade?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah huh!! Cover yourself up!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh right, right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t believe this! When someone asks you in for lemonade, and to you that means they wanna have sex?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well usually...yeah! Well, not just lemonade, iced tea, sometimes juice. Well, sorry, I just, I thought you liked me. I’m such a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s okay. I suppose it could happen to anyone, not anyone I know, but... By the way I can still see it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Where’s your bed?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s not in the apartment? Oh no. I can’t believe this is happening again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, enough with the third degree! I-I’ve, I don’t live here anymore.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I-I-I-I don’t live here anymore. I-I didn’t know how to tell you, but y'know everybody else knows!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Everybody knows!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That was supposed to be a good thing, I forget why. Just listen, Monica, I, do you know, okay, do you know, I couldn’t sleep for like a month because I got like a dot of ink on one of the sofa cushions.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you-you coulda just turned the cushion over.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I would’ve except I had a big spaghetti stain on the other side.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, this is what I’m talking about, this. I-I need to live in a land where people can spill.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You can spill. In the sink.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Aw, honey it’s not your fault, y'know this is who you are, and I love you, and I want us to be friends, and if I keep living here I don’t see that happening.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Aww, good. What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What? I’m just said.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No you’re not, you’re wondering which cushion it is.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So ah, whatcha watching?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Baywatch.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s it about?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Lifeguards.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it sounds kinda stupid... Who’s she?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nicole Eggert. You'll like her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow! Look at them run.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: They do that a lot. Hey, you want a beer?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll go get one.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no, don’t get up, I got a cooler right here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, hello!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you have any beers? We’re out of beers.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Help yourself.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe moved out.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t understand, I mean am I so hard to live, is this why I don’t have a boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Noo!! You don’t have a boyfriend because....I don’t, I don’t know why you don’t have a boyfriend. You should have a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I think so.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-ho, come here. Listen, you are one of my favourite people and the most beautiful woman I’ve ever known in real life.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi. Where is everybody?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it’s already closed, Chris gave me the keys to lock up-what is wrong?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My marriage, I think my marriage is um, is kinda over.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no! Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ‘Cause Carol’s a lesbian. And, and I’m not one. And apparently it’s not a mix and match situation.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! I don’t believe it! Oh, you poor bunny.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m an idiot. I mean shoulda seen it, I mean Carol and I’d be out and she’d, she’d see some beautiful woman, and, and she’d be Ross y'know look at her, and I’d think, God, my wife is cool!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Aw! Hey, do you think that Susan person is her lover?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, now I do!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Seven years. I mean we’ve been together seven years, she’s the only woman who’s ever loved me, and the only woman I’ve-I’ve ever....

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Aw, God Ross. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Umm, this is nice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know, it is isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I mean it, this feels really good. Is it a hundred percent cotton?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! And I got it on sale, too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Anyway, I should go, one of the lifeguards was just about to dismantle a nuclear device.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, if you wanna get a drink later we can.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, that sounds great. Oh, and listen, it’s, it’s gonna be....

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Maybe this would’ve happened if I’d been more nurturing, or I’d paid more attention, or I... had a uterus. I can’t believe this!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know no, no, y'know you don’t deserve this, you don’t Ross. You’re, you’re really, you’re so good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And you’re so sweet. And you’re kind

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My foot is stuck in the pocket.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I can’t get it out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, that’s not something a girl wants to hear.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, come on don’t start. Ouch!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Stupid balls are in the way.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh well. It probably would’ve been the most constructive solution.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You have chalk on your face.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, Ross you’re right, I don’t know why I always thought this was real grass.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My wife’s a lesbian.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Cool!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross-Joey, Joey-Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t believe you came back.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Don’t say anything. I don’t wanna speak, I don’t wanna think. I just want you to take me and kiss me and make love to me right here, right now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um, Barry.
